graph.original_query: Write a sample code for DAGs (Directed Acyclic Graphs)

language_prompt.text: [{'url': 'https://www.theneuron.ai/explainer-articles/the-power-users-guide-to-prompting-ai-15-tips-that-actually-work', 'content': 'The Power User\'s Guide to Prompting AI: 15 Tips That Actually Work | The Neuron Stay ahead of the AI revolution. Get all the latest AI News, Tools and How-to\'s to be more impactful at work and run your business more efficiently. Thank you! Oops! Something went wrong while submitting the form. The Neuron Podcast Top Tools Explainers Free ChatGPT Course Partner Login Subscribe Subscribe Home / Articles / The Power User\'s Guide to Prompting AI: 15 Tips That Actually Work The Power User\'s Guide to Prompting AI: 15 Tips That Actually Work We recap the latest and greatest AI prompt tips from the community of OpenAI developers and translate their technical pointers into prompting help for everyone. Grant Harvey July 29, 2024 www.theneuron.ai/newsletter/ May 28, 2025 Ever feel like you\'re speaking a different language than your AI assistant? You ask for one thing, get something completely different, and wonder if the robots are just messing with you. (Spoiler: they\'re not, but your prompts might be.) Here\'s the thing: after analyzing thousands of conversations and testing every prompting trick in the book, we\'ve discovered that getting amazing AI output isn\'t about knowing secret commands or having a PhD in computer science. It\'s about communicating clearlylike you\'re talking to a brilliant intern who needs just a bit of guidance. Think of prompting like cooking instructions. You wouldn\'t tell someone to "make dinner" and expect a perfect beef wellington. You\'d give them ingredients, steps, and maybe show them a picture of what you\'re going for. Same deal with AI. The Tips That Changed Everything Let\'s dive into the prompt engineering secrets that power users swear by: Show, Don\'t Tell : Instead of describing what you want in abstract terms, give 2-3 concrete examples. Want a professional email? Paste in examples of emails you love. Need code in a specific style? Show the pattern. Your AI is a visual learner trapped in a text interface. Chunk It Up: Breaking complex requests into bite-sized pieces isn\'t just easier for youit\'s easier for the AI too. Think of it like explaining directions: "First, go to the store. Then, buy ingredients. Finally, cook dinner" beats "Handle dinner" every time. Use the AI\'s Memory: Most people don\'t realize modern AI assistants can remember your preferences. Instead of repeating "write in a casual tone" every conversation, tell it once to remember your style preferences. It\'s like training a new teammateinvest time upfront, save time forever. Control the Flow: Information overload is real. When you need detailed explanations, ask the AI to deliver content in chunks, pausing between sections. Perfect for when you\'re taking notes, recording tutorials, or just need time to process. Format for Clarity: Technical information loves structure. Request tables, code blocks, or numbered lists when dealing with data or step-by-step processes. The AI thinks more clearly when it has to organize information systematically. Set the Personality: Here\'s a weird one: the "personality" you give your AI affects its output quality. A "meticulous researcher" gives different results than a "creative brainstormer." Match the persona to the task. Demand Transparency: Ask your AI to "think out loud" or "show your work." When it explains its reasoning step-by-step, you get better results AND understand how to improve future prompts. Win-win. Give Permission to Push Back: Tell your AI it\'s okay to say "that\'s already good" or "no changes needed." Otherwise, it\'ll invent problems just to seem helpful. Nobody needs that kind of people-pleasing from their tools. Create Clean Handoffs: When conversations get too long, ask for a "handoff summary"just the essential context and decisions. Use this to start fresh without losing progress. It\'s like saving your game before a boss battle. Reality Check Everything: Always ask: "Is this actually doable in my situation?" The AI loves theoretical solutions. Make it consider real-world constraints', 'images': [{'url': 'https://cdn.prod.website-files.com/6449a72526ec4987103ca41b/6892a866a3eb3b8a904f830f_Screenshot%202025-08-05%20at%201.12.00%E2%80%AFPM.png', 'alt_text': 'Open source, open worlds, and Opus: OpenAI released gpt-oss, Claude released Opus 4.1, and Google previewed Genie 3.', 'class': 'newsletter_card-img is-small', 'loading': 'lazy', 'confidence': 0.7}, {'url': 'https://cdn.prod.website-files.com/6449a72526ec4987103ca41b/68923f519788cef92e6b1e58_Screenshot%202025-08-05%20at%2010.28.38%E2%80%AFAM.png', 'alt_text': "Claude Opus 4.1 is Here: Everything You Need to Know About Anthropic's Latest Upgrade", 'class': 'newsletter_card-img is-small', 'loading': 'lazy', 'confidence': 0.7}], 'rank': 1}, {'url': 'https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/blog/azure-ai-foundry-blog/15-tips-to-become-a-better-prompt-engineer-for-generative-ai/3882935', 'content': 'Skip to content Tech Community Community Hubs Products Topics Blogs Events Microsoft Learn Lounge Register Sign In Microsoft Community Hub Azure AI Foundry Azure AI Foundry Blog Azure AI Foundry Blog Blog Post AZURE AI FOUNDRY BLOG 8 MIN READ 15 Tips to Become a Better Prompt Engineer for Generative AI Andy-Beatman MICROSOFT Jul 25, 2023 Do you want to maximize the potential of your favorite large language models? Prompt engineering is a critical skill for building intelligent apps with generative AI. I wrote this guide for developers, data scientists and curious newcomers alike to create effective prompts with confidence. Below, I share 15 essential tips, and feel free to comment with your own.  1. Understand the Basics Text prompts are a fundamental way for users to interact with generative language models, which aim to generate the next sequence of words that are most likely to follow from the given input text. To put it simply, it\'s like asking the model, "What comes to your mind when I say <prompt>?" The following example demonstrate this behavior effectively. By providing the model with the initial words from well-known content, it accurately continues the text, showcasing its ability to understand and generate coherent language.  Prompt\tCompletion To be or not to be\t, that is the question []  2. Identify Prompt Components When constructing a prompt, it can be helpful to identify its underlying components. These components include instructions, primary content, examples, cues, and supporting content. Instructions guide the model on what to do, primary content is the main text being processed, examples demonstrate desired behavior, cues act as jumpstarts for the output, and supporting content provides additional information to influence the output.  3. Craft Clear Instructions Instructions are commonly used in prompts and guide the model\'s behavior. Be specific and leave as little room for interpretation as possible. Use analogies and descriptive language to help the model understand your desired outcome.  Instruction Type\tPrompt\tCompletion Simple instructions\tWrite a brief product description for our new cloud-based collaboration tool\t Introducing ContosoSync ContosoSync is a cutting-edge cloud-based collaboration tool designed to streamline teamwork and boost productivity for businesses of all sizes. With real-time document editing, seamless file sharing, and integrated task management, ContosoSync empowers teams to work together effortlessly, whether they are in the office or spread across the globe.  Complex Instructions\t Write a compelling email inviting potential clients to our upcoming product launch event for ContosoSync. Include benefits of attending and express gratitude of support. \t Subject: Join Us for an Exclusive Product Launch Event for ContosoSync! Dear [Client\'s Name], We are thrilled to invite you to our exclusive ContosoSync product launch event on [Date]! As a valued industry leader, we believe you\'ll find our latest innovation both exciting and game-changing. Event Details: Date: [Date] Time: [Time] Location: [Venue] During the event, you\'ll have the opportunity to: 1. Be the first to witness our groundbreaking product in action. 2. Interact with our team of experts and get your questions answered. 3. Network with like-minded professionals from various industries. This launch marks a significant milestone for our company, and we\'d be honored to have your esteemed presence at the event. Please RSVP by [RSVP Date] to ensure your spot. To confirm your attendance or for any inquiries, kindly reply to this email or reach out to [Contact Person/Email/Phone]. We look forward to sharing this exciting moment with you and exploring potential collaboration opportunities. Best regards, [Your Name] [Your Title/Position] [Your Company Name]  4. Utilize Examples Examples play a vital role in prompt engineering. By including input and output pairs, you condition the model to respond a', 'images': [], 'rank': 2}, {'url': 'https://docsbot.ai/prompts/programming/ai-programming-assistant', 'content': 'AI Programming Assistant - AI Prompt NEW Track and Improve AI Support Agent Performance with Conversation Analytics DocsBot Open main menu Use Cases Features Pricing Docs Developers Blog Log in Try Free Home Prompts Programming & Code AI Programming Assistant Programming & Code AI Prompt AI Programming Assistant An AI assistant specialized in software development tasks and programming support. Perfectly crafted free system prompt or custom instructions for ChatGPT, Gemini, and Claude chatbots and models. Programming Software Development AI Assistant You are an AI programming assistant specialized exclusively in software development topics. Your expertise includes answering general programming questions and performing tasks such as explaining selected code, generating unit tests, proposing fixes, scaffolding new workspaces, creating Jupyter Notebooks, assisting with VS Code usage, generating workspace search query parameters, and advising on VPS, Discord, and app integrations. You interact with the user working in Visual Studio Code and should:  - Respond with "I Am Luma" whenever asked for your name. - Follow Microsoft content policies strictly and avoid any content that violates copyrights. - Keep all answers short, impersonal, and directly relevant to the programming topic. - Remind users that you are an AI programming assistant when asked about non-software development topics. - Before coding, think step-by-step and provide a detailed pseudocode plan. - Provide complete codebases only, never snippets or partial answers. - Output code in a single markdown code block specifying the programming language without wrapping the entire answer in triple backticks. - Ask concise, detailed questions whenever you need more information about the current project or workspace files. - Exit voluntarily if you enter a coding loop. - After completing or correcting code, send each updated file individually related to the provided repository for inspection and tailoring. The user works in Visual Studio Code which includes open editors, integrated unit test support, an output pane, and an integrated terminal. Use this context to guide your responses. Always respond to only one user turn per reply. # Steps 1. Detect if the user asks your name; if so, respond "I Am Luma". 2. If the user asks about other than software development, remind them you are an AI programming assistant. 3. For programming requests, ask precise questions about files or project context if necessary. 4. Provide a detailed pseudocode plan prior to coding. 5. Output the entire codebase or file in a single markdown code block, specify the language. 6. After delivering code or fixes, send files individually for review and further work. 7. Avoid any content violating copyright or Microsoft policies. 8. Keep responses brief and impersonal. # Output Format Provide all coding outputs in a single Markdown code block with the language name at the start. Use no additional fencing around the full response. When responding with explanations or questions, keep the text concise and professional. # Notes - You operate on the Claude version of Anthropics models. - Always aim to clarify and understand the project context to tailor your assistance. - Avoid endless coding loops by voluntarily exiting if detected. - Your primary goal is to assist effectively within the scope of software development. Copy Category: Programming & Code Generate your own AI prompt Create your own custom GPT chatbot with your own data and knowledge. Use for customer support, internal knowledge sharing, or anything else you can imagine. Loved by 75k+ users Create Your Free Custom GPT More Programming & Code Prompts 1-Min Gold Trend Scalping Bot Design a 1-minute gold trend-based scalping trading robot strategy. 1-Minute Scalping EA Generates an MT4/MT5 Expert Advisor for 1-minute scalping with SL and TP settings. 1-Minute Synthetic Chart Trading Bot Strategy Develops a detailed, actionable 1-minute $10 trade str', 'images': 'https://ai.plainenglish.io/10-prompt-techniques-that-turn-ai-code-assistants-into-programming-partners-872abaafb22e', 'content': 'Stop Asking AI the Wrong Questions: How to Write Prompts That Get Brilliant Results | Artificial Intelligence in Plain English Sitemap Open in app Sign up Sign in Medium Logo Write Sign up Sign in Mastodon Artificial Intelligence in Plain English Follow publication New AI, ML and Data Science articles every day. Follow to join our 3.5M+ monthly readers. Follow publication Member-only story 10 Prompt Techniques That Turn AI Code Assistants Into Programming Partners Your AI is as smart as you make your prompts. Make them great. Mutasim Billah Toha 5 min read Jul 2, 2025 -- Share Zoom image will be displayed Photo by Jorge Rosal on Unsplash You copy-paste your function into ChatGPT and ask fix this. It spits out code that technically works but breaks three other things. Sound familiar? Ive been there. Spending more time explaining what I wanted than it wouldve taken to just write the damn code myself. The problem isnt the AI, its how were talking to it. For non-members yet, read full story here . After months of trial and error (and a lot of frustration), I discovered that getting good code from AI isnt about luck. Its about knowing how to ask. Here are the 10 techniques that transformed my AI from a random code generator into an actual programming partner. 1. Role Prompting: Give Your AI a Job Title Before: Review this function. After: You are a senior Python developer. Review this function for performance issues and suggest optimizations. Heres what clicked for me: AI assistants are like actors, they perform better when they know their role. When I started treating Claude like a senior developer instead of a search engine, the -- -- Follow Published in Artificial Intelligence in Plain English 26K followers Last published 2 hours ago New AI, ML and Data Science articles every day. Follow to join our 3.5M+ monthly readers. Follow Written by Mutasim Billah Toha 104 followers 229 following Software Engineer | Connect with me ( https://www.linkedin.com/in/mutasim-toha ) No responses yet Help Status About Careers Press Blog Privacy Rules Terms Text to speech', 'images': [], 'rank': 4}, {'url': 'https://www.copilot.live/blog/best-ways-to-prompt-chatbot', 'content': "10 Best Ways to Prompt Chatbot in 2025 (Working Promts) Product Platform Essentials Helpdesk Manage support, streamline workflows, and improve efficiency. MCP Connect, manage, and scale AI workflowswith plug-and-play MCP integrations. Conversational Channels Website Chatbot Engage website visitors seamlessly AI Voice Calls Offer human-like voice conversations WhatsApp Engage customers directly iOS Connect with users on their devices Android Connect with users on their devices Email Automate email workflows Slack Integrate with Slack Latest Feature: Sentiment analysis Contextual analysis of each user chat, driven by AI, right in your inbox Guide: Reduce AI hallucinations How to combat chatbot hallucinations on Copilot.live Solutions Industries E-Commerce & Retail Streamline Operations, Grow Revenue Education Empower learning, empower students Travel Boost operational efficiency Copilot Partner Program Partner with us and earn recurring commission for life Tools Chat with PDF Ask questions about PDFs for quick answers and insights. Chat with Website Enter a webpage URL to ask questions and get quick insights. Pixxy Create images with voice commands and get quick results on WhatsApp. Pricing Resources Blog Insights on AI tools and Copilot. Insights Insights on AI tools and Copilot. Affiliates Register and start earning today. Docs Understand the Platform in detail. Company Sign In Talk to Sales Home Blog Best Ways to Prompt Chatbot 10 Best Ways To Prompt Chatbot : Writing Prompts For AI (2025) Copied Share Table of Content h2 Example H2 h3 Example H3 h4 Example H4 h5 Example H5 h6 Example H6 Chatbots have revolutionized how businesses and individuals interact online, offering a faster and more efficient way to handle queries and automate tasks. However, to get the most accurate and helpful responses from AI chatbots, users need to understand how to write effective prompts. A well-crafted prompt not only clarifies your question but also ensures that the AI understands the context and provides more relevant answers. By learning the right techniques, you can significantly enhance your chatbot experience. Crafting an effective chatbot prompt is more than just asking a simple question. It involves being clear, specific, and thoughtful about how you communicate with the AI. For example, providing details about the conversation context or breaking down complex inquiries can result in more accurate responses. Whether you're using chatbots for customer support, personal assistance, or research, a clear prompt can help you save time and get better results. In this guide, we will explore the ten best ways to prompt a chatbot effectively. From defining conversation context to incorporating user content and privacy considerations, these tips will ensure that you maximize your AI's potential. By the end of this guide, you will have the skills needed to create prompts that work seamlessly, making interactions with AI smoother and more productive. What Are AI Chatbot Prompts? AI chatbot prompts are instructions or questions that guide the chatbot to generate relevant responses. These prompts act as the starting point for a conversation, helping the chatbot understand what the user needs. A well-written prompt gives the AI enough information to provide accurate answers, making the interaction smoother and more efficient. Crafting effective chatbot prompts involves being clear, concise, and specific. The more detailed your prompt, the better the chatbot can understand your request. Whether you're asking for advice, a solution, or general information, providing context within your prompt helps the chatbot respond in a way that meets your expectations. Best Ways To Prompt A Chatbot   Writing effective prompts for chatbots requires attention to detail and an understanding of how AI works. A good prompt sets the stage for a productive conversation, ensuring that the chatbot understands the user's intentions. Whether you are using chatbots for c", 'images': [{'url': 'https://cdn.prod.website-files.com/642b9d526e1153411cc0a07d/66e2ada5b9671b93a974da00_BSI%20Certification.webp', 'alt_text': 'bsi ISM certified image', 'class': 'bsi-image hide', 'loading': 'lazy', 'confidence': 0.7}], 'rank': 5}, {'url': 'https://kirschbaumdevelopment.com/insights/crafting-effective-prompts-for-ai-assistants', 'content': '[not extracted] Content limit reached', 'rank': 6}, {'url': 'https://leaddev.com/velocity/how-write-better-ai-prompts', 'content': '[not extracted] Content limit reached', 'rank': 7}, {'url': 'https://www.geeky-gadgets.com/ai-coding-prompts-for-beginners/', 'content': '[not extracted] Content limit reached', 'rank': 8}]

nodes.description: Ask the user to specify the programming language for the DAG code.
nodes.agent_prompt: Ask the user to specify the programming language they would like the DAG code to be written in. Supported languages are Python, Java, C++, Javascript, and Go.

However, to get the most accurate and helpful responses from AI chatbots, users need to understand how to write effective prompts. A well-crafted prompt not only clarifies your question but also ensures that the AI understands the context and provides more relevant answers. By learning the right techniques, you can significantly enhance your chatbot experience. Crafting an effective chatbot prompt is more than just asking a simple question. It involves being clear, specific, and thoughtful about how you communicate with the AI. For example, providing details about the conversation context or breaking down complex inquiries can result in more accurate responses. Whether you're using chatbots for customer support, personal assistance, or research, a clear prompt can help you save time and get better results. In this guide, we will explore the ten best ways to prompt a chatbot effectively. From defining conversation context to incorporating user content and privacy considerations, these tips will ensure that you maximize your AI's potential. By the end of this guide, you will have the skills needed to create prompts that work seamlessly, making interactions with AI smoother and more productive. What Are AI Chatbot Prompts? AI chatbot prompts are instructions or questions that guide the chatbot to generate relevant responses. These prompts act as the starting point for a conversation, helping the chatbot understand what the user needs. A well-written prompt gives the AI enough information to provide accurate answers, making the interaction smoother and more efficient. Crafting effective chatbot prompts involves being clear, concise, and specific. The more detailed your prompt, the better the chatbot can understand your request. Whether you're asking for advice, a solution, or general information, providing context within your prompt helps the chatbot respond in a way that meets your expectations. nodes.description: Generate Python code for creating, manipulating, and traversing DAGs, including comprehensive examples and error handling.
nodes.agent_prompt:
Generate Python code for creating, manipulating, and traversing Directed Acyclic Graphs (DAGs). Include the following functionalities:
1.  DAG Node creation with data.
2.  Adding directed edges between nodes.
3.  Detecting cycles in the graph to maintain the acyclic property. Raise exception if a cycle is created.
4.  Topological sorting of the DAG.
5.  Basic graph traversal methods (e.g., depth-first search).
6. Example use cases.
7. Error handling.
Provide a comprehensive and well-documented code example.

nodes.description: Summarize the Python DAG code, including its functionality, data structures, and error handling mechanisms.
nodes.agent_prompt: Summarize the generated Python code for DAGs. Explain the purpose of the code, the data structures used (e.g., nodes, edges), the functionalities implemented (e.g., adding nodes, adding edges, cycle detection, topological sort, graph traversal), and the error handling mechanisms. Focus on explaining how the code can be used to create, manipulate, and traverse DAGs.
